website_summaries.verdict: This small bookcase is a solid affordable option.
pros: Straightforward assembly and a surprisingly sturdy design make this bookshelf a good option for those on a budget
Even when fully loaded, this case rotates smoothly on a ball-bearing base
Eight shelves provide an adequate amount of storage
cons: At 8.5 inches in height, the shelves may be too small for bigger books
A bit of wood glue may be needed to keep pegs secure

website_summaries.verdict: Tough media storage tower that is smaller than average to fit almost anywhere.
pros: Shelving system allows you to store all different kinds of media
Good design for maximizing the storage space you have available
Nice-looking media tower with a stylish contemporary design
Includes steel rods in the frame to provide a good build quality
cons: Holds only up to 144 DVD cases, so it's small-ish

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shelf for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good solid shelf, holds the 100 plus dvds I have all on one side, havent even touched the second side. Build was super straight forward, might be a little confusing if you’ve never put something like this together before, but it wont take long. Durrability lost a star for the bearing roler that this sits on. It does function but its very weak plastic and it has to stay perfectly clean. Dirt gets intothe track and binds it up. Also the bearings are rusting after only a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: daniel sparks

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted to surprise me and put it together while I was out. When I returned from shopping he was still working on it. I tried helping him but it had me confused. Our son helped out until it was somewhat together. The directions were difficult to understand and the pieces kept falling out when trying to assemble it. It looks good on the picture but trying to assemble it is a headache! :(
customer_reviews.author: QUEEN ESTHER BOYD

customer_reviews.title: Works great, lots of capacity in a small footprint.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how other reviewers thought this was difficult to put together. I do agree that using a good wood glue to fix the dowels in the first piece helps. I used Weldbond and let it sit for about 15 minutes in the first piece, before putting the pieces together. The directions were clear and in fact it was almost totally obvious just from the construction of the parts. Admittedly, I am an engineer so I probably have a bit of an advantage there. It also holds a lot of DVDs and rotates smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: SA Mathman

customer_reviews.title: Take your time!!  Best to put together in two stages.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a disabled mechanic and cabinet maker, so I find putting things together from scratch easier than most. One of the initial steps requires using at least 24 loose fitting wooden dowels to put this unit together. I put a liberal amount of wood glue on each dowel and put together the first two assemblies utilizing two 18" wood clamps to help keep each together, and then I let it set for an hour. Everything is clearly marked; the instructions are a little small; but if you take your time, this unit is easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: ransley56

customer_reviews.title: difficult to assemble but great once completed
customer_reviews.text: This arrived yesterday and today I assembled it. Heed the warnings about assembly. A number of pieces are connected by small pegs--dowel pieces. No problem except at a certain point the pieces kept coming apart. Even with my husband helping by holding things together it kept coming apart until the final piece is attached by screws. Also, I had to redrill a number of the holes because they were too short Having complained about assembly, I have to say it seems very sturdy. I haven't finished putting my cd s on so I can't comment on durability. I like the look and feel.just have help on hand for assembly. That's why I only gave four stars
customer_reviews.author: C. Hindin

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to assemble, even after several days of trying.
customer_reviews.text: I echo the sentiment of another reviewer, run away screaming!! This purchase is not worth the time it's taking me to assemble it, and I'm still working it. For a unit as small as this one I expected it to be a breeze to assemble. Im done trying and will be sending it back...pronto!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the item, just not crazy about the assembly
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, but assembly was a bit iffy. This isn't the worst self-assembled item I've ever purchased, not by a long shot, but there are significant annoyances that make it difficult. First, they should note before you start that you will need a Phillips head screwdriver. Second, identifier stickers were missing from a number of the parts/panels. The illustrations showed one part, for example, as about 1/3 the width of the actual piece, and I spend long, unproductive minutes searching through boxes and trash wondering if I had accidentally thrown it away with the packing material. I love the look, though, so I was willing to put up with the aggravation of putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Polly Cy

customer_reviews.title: May Require 2 People To Assemble
customer_reviews.text: I usually have no problem with any do it yourself assembly. It was very helpful to have my wife hold the unit when I put in the final screws at the bottom which secures the assembly. The small wood dowels provided do not stay in place and without her help it kept falling apart while I tried to hold it at the same time securing the screws. Once completed the unit is sturdy, stable, looks great and held our collection of DVDs .
customer_reviews.author: DxCm12

customer_reviews.title: nightmare!
customer_reviews.text: This DVD holder has a million little dowels that have to get aligned w/ a million little holes. The pipes shown are an additional cruelty. The "wood" is cheap fiber board. Assembly could have been easy w/ a couple well placed screws. conclusion: definitely not recommended. Trash bin!
customer_reviews.author: RickMeister

customer_reviews.title: Great, but a PITA to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The media shelf is great...if you can make it pass the assemble part. It’s definitely one of the hardest, if not hardest, things I’ve assembled. And believe me, I’ve ordered bookshelves, media storage shelves, dinning set, and a couch from Amazon in the past. What makes this hard to assemble is that fact that you have very little things to screw. Everything is held like a sandwich where the top is where you screw the final product down. Definitely not an easy product to assemble if you have trouble following you instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the reviews make this sound difficult to assemble. It is not. I put it together by myself in under an hour. If you've ever assembled furniture before, you'll have no problem. There were a few places that the wood had scratches and one spot where the 'wood paper' was peeled back, but luckily these were easy to fix with a sharpie and some glue. Perfect storage unit, stylish, and great price. Just ordered another one!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: A nice DVD shelf
customer_reviews.text: I was sick of my Blu Rays and video games getting knocked over so bought this, and it is a very nice little shelf. It is a bit short in my opinion, as I ended up putting it on top of a cabinet, but otherwise I was very happy with it. Build time is less than an hour, and it is surprisingly sturdy for its size/thickness. I think this is due to the metal supports on each of the 4 corners.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Solid finish, not so solid building
customer_reviews.text: There are very few occasion when I have wanted to throw parts across the room, but this is one of them. Building the kit is like building a house of cards, they keep following over and over until you get one right. Like Ron Perlman in 'Quest for Fire', the harder you try to hold what you have the more things fall down. That being said, when complete, it's as solid as a brick outhouse. Get help or use straps and save yourself the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Haskell

customer_reviews.title: Really nice rotating stand
customer_reviews.text: I am using this from my beading supplies. This rotating media stand allows me to see my bead cups at a glance and has plenty of room for the odds and ends related to my crafting. I would recommend this product for its intended purpose, as a book shelf for children's books . The assembly instruction were clear enough, but it took a bit of practice to get the pieces together as the wooden dowels didn't stay in the holes well. All in all a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hartt

customer_reviews.title: Spinner isn’t working right
customer_reviews.text: It’s plywood, so needed to be very careful when putting the screws in. My biggest complaint is the spinner on the bottom. After putting it all together and loading it with DVD’s, it won’t spin. I had it on top of a wood desk and when I’d try to spin it, it moves all over and marked up the desk. Will have to maybe try with a large piece of floor tile under it possibly.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: The directions are very helpful but could be better. I did end up using wood glue on ...
customer_reviews.text: End product was a complete success. You really have to be careful putting it together. The directions are very helpful but could be better. I did end up using wood glue on the sides with the wooden dowels. Without wood glue the sides bow out in the middle because there are no screws there. Other than that no complains whatsoever. Holds a lot for such a small rack, very sturdy, spins well enough, and my fiancé says really nice. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Good Sized
customer_reviews.text: This unit was the most God-awful thing I've ever had to assemble and after putting it together, I can see why they ask over $80 for assembly. It isn't a simple job and I think it would be better if the instructions had larger pictures, but once you get past the assembly, it's a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: SDG

customer_reviews.title: A Nice DVD Holder
customer_reviews.text: If you can tighten a screw and follow instructions, you can put this together. Kudos to the person who said to use wood glue on the dowels. I took that advice and I have a very sturdy item. Take your time with this. Identify all the pieces before you begin and assembly will be easy. I’m pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Fleischer

customer_reviews.title: dont buy unless plenty of patience and time
customer_reviews.text: t he finished product is very nice, but the assembly is a nightmare. The dowels are worthless, it needs more screws, not dowels that won' t stay in place. Everytime you try to adjust it, it all falls apart again. I would really get a different model of a storage for CDs
customer_reviews.author: music lover

customer_reviews.title: Great little shelf for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little shelf. I like it so much I might get another. I will warn that if you're doing this alone, you're going to have to be patient. I'd recommend laying it on its side when putting in pegs. I found this easier. Took around an hour to assemble and looks pretty good. Not show room looking but for the price, you get your money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: David Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Know your construction, and beware.
customer_reviews.text: I was truly disappointed with this item. All items came as said, however; Getting this item took 3 people to put it together, as it kept falling apart in the middle of assembly. Having been familiar with this type of construction, I was deeply saddened.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Ilagan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Followed directions. Got the whole thing together and top slide locks came apart. This took forever by myself to put together. What a waste of a Saturday night. Wish I would not have thrown box away or this would be going back. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight poorly made GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. It is so lightweight I doubt it could hold anywhere near the number of DVDs it claims. And the worst part? Piece C, the piece that holds the two sections together, didn’t come with the pre-drilled holes so I had to do it. It wasn’t worth putting it all back in the box and shipping it back so now I have a crappy paperweight or a cat toy (even though I don’t have any cats). Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Loudon

customer_reviews.title: This is actually pretty nice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for craft shows thinking it would be good since it spins. Well, people couldn’t figure that out. Even with signs lol The shelf is very nice and looked great after moving it around to shows. Unfortunately we had a house fire so I only got to use it for a couple of months and can’t attest to long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey F.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and a bit unsteady
customer_reviews.text: So I love this stand, the issue is I got my first one at a yard sale for $3 for having to pay $50+ for the second was a shock. It is not the easiest thing to assemble but the instructions do label every piece and explain how to assemble. I do suggest wood glue to keep it together better. I will say in the future I will something else that stores dvds to save money. $50+ for something I have to assemble and is a bit unsteady is not worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assembly?
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product at a reasonable price. The suggestion to use glue because of the wood dowls is a outstanding suggestion. Assembling this unit alone without help can be challenging. I found that it was difficult to hold the unit together as you assembled the next level on the stack. I found that clamps used in the construction of cabinetry does the trick. Once I used those, assembly was much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: I would say for the price this product is pretty good. Could be a little bit sturdier but I coulda doesn't more too. It's a good size, lots of storage room, the spinner works fine. Don't wanna spin it too fast or it'll tip over though.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, feels pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised, and worth the $40.00 that I paid for it (but not more). Looks good, feels pretty solid, at least solid enough for its purpose. Assembly was a breeze (I would also glue the wood dowels in, as somebody previously suggested). Some have complained that it's much smaller than pictured, which I really don't understand. It's four shelves, each about the height of a DVD case. Seems pretty straightforward. If you need a giant tower, this isn't what you're looking for. I'm probably going to order another one for what remains of my CD collection.
customer_reviews.author: George D. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Very nice rack but bring a friend to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I got this about 2 weeks ago. So far I love it and plan to buy another soon. It spins smooth, seems very sturdy and seems true to advertised capacity though I haven't unpacked all my movies yet to test it. Something to note: I put this together by myself but could have really used a second pair of hand. It would have gone A LOT quicker. The instructions were clear and all the parts were labeled, though a few of the labels on mine had fallen off in transit but it worked out fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's quite good for the price actually
customer_reviews.text: Since I find that wall media storage racks to be rather wobbly, I went with this spinner instead. It's quite good for the price actually. Instructions are standard for the type of item, I had no issues during assembly. I would recommend using some wood glue on the dowels, a small drop in the holes will do it. Otherwise the sides are slightly less secure. Don't get me wrong, the spinner is not unstable without wood glue, it's just it will be a tad sturdier if you use some (just don't overdo the glue).
customer_reviews.author: DrowNoble

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: It fits great for the small area I have to store all of my DVDs. We were able to fit between 18 and 20 DVDs per shelf and still had room to devote 2 shelves to boxes sets! It's so nice to not have DVDs sitting under the tv stand!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: One board did not have the properly drilled holes, had to do a little creative engineering to get it put together and stable. Otherwise, it's a decent bookcase (I used it to store video game cases) --
customer_reviews.author: Alicia A. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, purchased 1 for each side of the tv
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it was to assemble. My only major ding on this product is that it would be even sturdier if the 2nd set of poles actually had connecting screws- they're just slid in between the holes in the shelves, stacked on top of one another. No worries. We ended up getting 2 of them and they work great as columns flanking each side of the tv (43"), which was a cheap, great match with IKEA's wide BESTÅ tv unit.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for DVD storage!
customer_reviews.text: I had some trouble with assembly. The directions were not always clear on which way to attach the board and there were more holes on different sides. Very sturdy. Looks just like the picture. I like that the base swivels.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Usefull
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a great deal. I like how the rotating feature essentially doubles the storage capacity. It was easy to put together and the finished product is stable and looks great. Definitely worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.author: WayniaK

customer_reviews.title: Poor Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are poorly written. Been Spending most time putting together and getting headaches. Most Frustrating thing is wood pegs can't hold together. Will never buy another one these.
customer_reviews.author: maryjean hunter

customer_reviews.title: It's a sturdy little shelf
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for years and purchased a second. It's a sturdy little shelf, and does it's job well. I took away one star because it's on the difficult side to assemble. I buy a lot of furniture that needs to be assembled and usually have no issues, but the instructions for this one aren't the best. We got it done, but it took longer than expected.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: THIS UNIT IS NOT WORTH BUYING.
customer_reviews.text: MY WIFE PUT IT TOGETHER AND IT JUST FELL APART AND SHE WENT BY THE INSTRUCTIONS AND SHE HAS ASSEMBLED WHOLE WALL UNITS FROM/ FOR TOOLS/ CRAFTMANS AND ONE OTHER PRO-STYLE WALL AND TALL CABINETS SO SHE'S VERY CAPABLE BUT SHE SAID THAT THIS ITEM WAS CRAP!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: And so I try !🤯
customer_reviews.text: You must have an mechanics or construction license!! Needs two sets of hands and glue for the pegs !! Not easy to assemble, design wasn't thought for beginners or moderate. NOT A GOOD FIT !!!
customer_reviews.author: M. P. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews of the difficulty in assembling this tower. At first I thought so and then it dawned on me to use a drop of wood glue in each hole as I put the wooden dowels in and allow that to dry. PROBLEM SOLVED. after that assembly was super easy.
customer_reviews.author: fubar

customer_reviews.title: A lot of storage for the money
customer_reviews.text: It can be a little tricky to put together. There are a couple of steps where parts can come apart before completion of the step. Overall it didn't take too long to install and certainly hold a lot of cds and/or videos.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Carter

customer_reviews.title: Wood glue is a must!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say that it was easy to assemble it, but it wasn't that hard. I do recommend using a wood glue to assemble it. It's a pain if you don't use it. I had a good amount of blu ray movies and while it was a bit of pain to assemble, it was worth the hassle. It looks great and no issue whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Noriega

customer_reviews.title: Good price and holds a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this storage for dvd cases. I am a Stamping Up demonstrator and all of my stamps are in dvd cases which fit perfectly in this rotating holder. Works great because it is on ball bearings.
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: Totally frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I found the process of putting this together totally and completely frustrating. The instructions were unclear and the design was from outer space. It seemed it required me to have 4 hands. I finally gave up and just dumped the stuff into the garbage. Somethings are just not worth the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence D. Haber

customer_reviews.title: Can be challenging to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Tricky to assemble but once together it is one of the best storage devices for dvds and blu-rays I’ve purchased. A lot of storage for a small footprint. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy, easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy...and as for assembly, if you have ever put together shelves, cubes, etc, you should have no problem. It took me 30 minutes in a walk in closet with a glass of wine. I am impressed with the weight of the shelving and how nicely it turns on the plastic wheel, even on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: CarrieN

customer_reviews.title: I just want what I paid for
customer_reviews.text: I think that you are very wrong for not making this right, my uncle is a state police officer I am going to talk with him to see if I can get what I paid for I am not asking for money back I just want what I paid for,
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Cole

customer_reviews.title: Dowel pins are too small, need two people for easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty easy to assemble. The only problem is the dowel pins are too narrow for the pre-drilled holes. This unfortunately means that while assembling, any movement will allow the pieces held together by the dowel pins to fall apart. It would be helpful to have two people during assembly in some of the steps for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: tkqrud

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Could be easier- But Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This DVD/BluRay holder is sturdy. Spins was little, but it’s annoying to put together. I would buy again because it’s a sleek design, and fits nicely in my Bedroom
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Nice but hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I like it but to put it together I had to hire someone. The instructions are not very clear. Even the handyman said "never again" 🤣🤣. But we live the finish product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I bought 2 of them about 4 years ago and loved how it’s a space saver! I accumulated more dvds and ended up ordering one more! I was worried it would arrive broken or flawed, but it came super fast and it was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: FredNTrish

customer_reviews.title: Good instructions. Set it up by myself
customer_reviews.text: Fast Delivery, Good instructions. Set it up by myself, no problem. The tip about using glue on the Dowels, helps a lot. The Glue also helps make it more stable. Finished product is a brick. It is a bit lighter in color , than I expected and I don't much care for the plastic roller with only 1 tiny screw holding it on.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage for DVDs and CDs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great solution to store all my old favorite movies and my kids' video games. It is compact and looks good, also fits anywhere and have a great capacity.
customer_reviews.author: fernandogranizo

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Horrible to assemble. The holes for screws didn't align in some places making the entire project more work than it should have been. Hopefully we get a year out of it before it falls apart. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great spinner DVD rack.
customer_reviews.text: I owned another version of this that I bought 7 years ago. I wanted another one as I have a DVD addiction. This one has silver tubes instead of the matching espresso color, but it still looks great. Love this thing. Holds LOTS of DVDs. The lazy Suzan is a little cheap. May consider replacing in the future but it wouldn't be too hard.
customer_reviews.author: The Wild Greek

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful. It was easy to put together for the most part. Some of the shelves were too hard to screw together. And sturdy is not an option with this. It’s very wiggly and the piece that it sits on to make it spin does not stay on. Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.author: manda

customer_reviews.title: a very good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for all our needs ! The fact that it rotates is a plus ! Assembly was tricky but not impossible - it is very sturdy when completed !
customer_reviews.author: Debra Willis

customer_reviews.title: Wood to small, wrong diamerter.
customer_reviews.text: Certain parts require it to be assembled and stay in place, with dowels, the wood parts, if they fail, it takes 6 hands to hold it in place to put the next pieces on. Do not move loaded, only empty.
customer_reviews.author: ACTIVE

customer_reviews.title: Assemble with a partner!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was ridiculous to do alone, like building a 3-foot house with popsicle sticks. Directions also a bit vague at times. But once done, it is reasonably sturdy and looks nice. Arrived fast.
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Too much money for such a small ítem that looks larger on picture and too much time to put it together. A scale from 1 to 10, I give it a (5).
customer_reviews.author: Alex Abarca

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what is pictured and described
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, it spins nice, it holds a lot more than I thought it would, it was fairly easy to put together I did need a little bit of help holding some pieces of wood together so I could screw it in though I would definitely have two people do this in certain spots
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is absolute trash. First of all, there are holes missing and you can’t drill them without cracking the “boards”. There are pieces that just refuse to fit together. It seriously should have been at the 99 cent store.
customer_reviews.author: L. Chumley

customer_reviews.title: Dismayed
customer_reviews.text: Instructions lack clarity, materials inadequate & sturdiness dubious. I’m still not finished assembling it & deeply regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tropical Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don't have wall space for wall mounted shelves
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little tower when you don't have the wall space for wall mounted shelving. Nice look, well designed, rotates as needed. I have two that I store games & movies in, due to a lack of wall space, and they have served me very well. My only complaint is that I feel like they could stand to be slightly wider. Perhaps by about 2-4in. Or have one more row. Either way is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to build, worth the sweat.
customer_reviews.text: Was missing hole in the bottom for the spinner but was easy enough to make one. Great for our video game collection. Compact enough for virtually any room. Price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this DVD stand!
customer_reviews.text: Love this DVD stand! It’s sturdy and stylish, which also contributes to a little more work putting it together. Took me about 90 minutes to put together by myself. Used Gorilla glue with the wood pegs to help hold it together like others recommended. I put this inside of a cabinet with a 1” lip, so put a 1”x12” board underneath to get the clearance needed for it to spin. Great outcome and looks wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: B. Tri

customer_reviews.title: and man does this look good! Not cheesy looking at all
customer_reviews.text: This holds all the hubbies xbox games- and there are alot, and man does this look good! Not cheesy looking at all. It coveniently holds all his games in one place, and it looks good in my livingroom. I'm very pleased ;) Oh- and so is he. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mitsuko

customer_reviews.title: This was so hard to put together. It is ...
customer_reviews.text: This was so hard to put together. It is almost impossible to put together by yourself, you need an extra person to hold it together while you put the screws in. The holes for the screws also aren't big enough so it ended up all screwed up. I wish I never bought this, I'm afraid it will fall apart because it got all messed up while building, even following instructions
customer_reviews.author: wesley womack

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect!
customer_reviews.text: For what I needed it to do, this spinner is absolutely perfect! The assembly was no joke though, took almost an hour by myself. However, once assembled, the tower is sturdy and spins well!
customer_reviews.author: btalem

customer_reviews.title: A heavy load
customer_reviews.text: It took two of us to drag this box into the house. I haven't even opened it yet--afraid of what I'll find. I don't believe the weight was listed in the description--or maybe I missed it. WARNING--it's a heavy load--hope it turns out to be worth it. Jan kohlsjb@idcnet.com
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. Take your time assembling it. The directions are good it just keeps coming loose/ apart until it is pretty much completely assembled. Lots of interesting words came out if my mouth in frustration but worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bookshelf!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. It is tricky to assemble but the instructions were good, parts were well marked, and the hardware was clearly labeled. It took me about 90 minutes to assemble while watching a movie. Overall a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: 1had2comment

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Media Storage
customer_reviews.text: I loved the first one I purchased so much I bought a second one. Very sturdy and stable. I highly recommend! Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Piece of CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of crap. It. Was hard to put together since I only have 2 hands. It lasted a full week before it came apart.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: but good lord, what a pain to put together
customer_reviews.text: It works well as a DVD holder, but good lord, what a pain to put together. I've built nine-drawer IKEA pieces with less grief than this. Once I figured out the overall structure, I abandoned the instructions completely.
customer_reviews.author: cneil

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We bought two of these to contain our large DVD collection, and we love them! They look great on both sides of our entertainment center and are modernized with the metal-looking accents. It is a bit of a pain to build, but once its together it looks very nice, and we get compliments about them often. For the price, look and amount of DVDs it can hold, you can't really go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: CHeck your shipent carefully
customer_reviews.text: One of the panels in this, mind you this is pressed board, not real wood, was crushed in one spot. I had already put the rest together, was able to use some super glue to strengthen, but what a bummer on a brand new product!! I also was shorted the main screw used to attach the swivel plate to the main shelving unit, so went scrounging to find what I needed to finish putting this together. I was a little disgrunted. [P]
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It's impossible to assemble. Important holes are missing. After almost 3 hours we decided to return it because any time you start drilling and altering the item structure there's a chance of it not working or falling apart later. The flimsy plastic lazy Susan on the bottom stand was discouraging so we repackaged it and it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: digtheisland

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: After several hours and a complete inability to get things to stay in place (even with using glue on the dowels), I've completely given up. What a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Nancybabs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It was a little smaller than expected but I absolutely lol love this. It fit our entire collection. I might even buy another one just to fit more.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Takes up very little room
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and takes up very little room. Glad to have our MCDs easily available.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Whidden

customer_reviews.title: great price and exactly what i was looking for ..
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a rotating space-saving dollhouse for my granddaughter's room .. this is exactly what I have been looking for and will serve the purpose perfectly .. this will give her 8 rooms for furniture and a roof terrace .. I will embellish the rooms with rugs and curtains and I am sure this will provide many manyyyy long hours of play for her .. after which, she can pass it down to her younger sister .. and if they ever grow out of the dollhouse idea, we can always use it as a dvd rack (which is the original intention of the product) .. ;)
customer_reviews.author: jgas

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, could be much better!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased and constructed the storage unit. For the price, it is a nice unit and organizes your DVD's very nicely. Like other reviews, the assembly was not complicated, just awkward. I reviewed the instructions very closely (which I rarely do) and made sure all the pieces and parts were laid out prior to starting. The one thing that I used that I would recommend is the use of a large clamp to hold the sections together while securing all of the wood dowels and screws. Otherwise, you will need an extra pair of hands. Also, make sure not to over tighten any of the fasteners or you will break off pieces of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: Media Spinner
customer_reviews.text: It was a challenge to put it together as some of holes were too large to hold the dowels and some holes were too small to hold the support screws. It kept falling apart, due to the above mentioned problems, because the dowels didn't hold it tight. I would suggest that 2 people would work better than 1 when putting it together. I love how many DVD's it holds and it is very attractive and is on a roller base so you can turn it around to see all the DVD's.
customer_reviews.author: country gal

customer_reviews.title: Very nice space.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality turntable at bottom. I bought casters for the bottom so I could move it. Otherwise, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: L L Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Decent, not the sturdiest
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to build alone but also not the hardest I've done. It doesn't look sturdy till completely built. The turning tray on the bottom is fragile and doesn't work well on my wood floor no matter how I adjust it. Only holds about 120 dvd (combo reg and blue ray)..mine is full already.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage and a nightmare to assemble. Cheap quality and workmanship. So far it seems to hold DVDs and such adequately, we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt G.

customer_reviews.title: It can be done alone!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build, people said it took 2 people to build, that's not always the case. I did it all by myself. It might be a little hard but it can be done. I am a female so if I could do it by myself then you can lol. The only thing I couldn't put on is the wheel thing on the bottom that helps spin. The hole was too small and it wouldn't let me screw it in. Other then that ir was fine.
customer_reviews.author: michellekho74

customer_reviews.title: Good economica, utilitarian choice
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit of a struggle to assemble - it took two people (four hands), but it came out fine, and holds lots of DVDs (or whatever), for very little money.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Ok for price
customer_reviews.text: It works. Difficult to assemble, a little rickety, but perfect for small space and a lot of dvd's.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ! Horrible, horrible to try to assemble and falls apart if you barely touch it.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe you could glue it together as you assemble it? Wish I had managed to get my stuff together to send this back. Oh well. Maybe I can pawn it off on one of the grands.
customer_reviews.author: Lane Maeve Alison

customer_reviews.title: Very Pretty
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we ordered because we loved the first one so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy...unless you like frustration
customer_reviews.text: Worst DIY I bought. Two people have tried to put this together and have been unsuccessful. Wasted over $40 on this.
customer_reviews.author: b.maurer

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions were not quite right!
customer_reviews.text: The top is still not completely adjusted. There is a gap that does not mesh!
customer_reviews.author: Mina Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: exactly what i needed, a tad shorter than i expected but i didn't need or look for a particular height so im not counting that as a negative. i wouldn't say it was 'easy' to assemble but i was able to do it alone with minimal confusion.
customer_reviews.author: mrmagness

customer_reviews.title: Perfect CD & DVD holder
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! Perfect fit for my needs of storage for my CD's & DVD's.
customer_reviews.author: misty

customer_reviews.title: Nice storage for DVD cases, small baskets, and more
customer_reviews.text: Assembly of almost any product can be a challenge, and this was comparable, but the assembly graphics were very good. The product spins easily on moderately plush carpet. Good capacity. The flat top is also good for storage in a basket or box. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: The Pen

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully but hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This CD/DVD unity holds quite a number of discs and the swivel feature makes it easy to locate your items. I can't say it was easy to put together. I would advise working with someone to assemble it as it is nearly impossible to hold the pieces in place while trying to bolt or screw them down simultaneously. The directions could also be a bit more clear. After I got someone to help me, it was much easier to complete it.
customer_reviews.author: Musicista

customer_reviews.title: Yes!! just what I was looking for☺️👍
customer_reviews.text: What can I truly say other than it gets the job done I have two of them... To be honest I will even get another because they come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: London

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, paper thin finish, comes in a hundred pieces
customer_reviews.text: Hard to adequately describe the cheap parts supplied with construction project. You could not pay me to buy this again. Doubtful once fully assembled it would last very long.
customer_reviews.author: John Baptist

product_meta.title: Atlantic Typhoon Media Spinner Unit - Fully Rotates 360 Degrees on a Ball Bearing Base, Holds 216 CDs, 144 DVDs, 4 Fixed Shelves, PN82635716 in, Espresso/Silver, accessory
product_meta.description: Model:82635716| Style:Media SpinnerMultimedia unit designed specifically to hold all media types. Fully rotates 360 degrees for optimal access to all media. Stylish design in Espresso with Silver fits all types of decors. Ball bearing rotating base provides smooth rotation. MDF Wood look in Espresso color.
feature_bullets: Multimedia unit designed specifically to hold all media types. Fully rotates 360 degrees for optimal access to all media. Stylish design in Espresso with Silver fits all types of decors. Ball bearing rotating base provides smooth rotation. MDF Wood look in Espresso
Space saving double sided configuration allows for flexibility in organization
Multimedia unit designed specifically to hold all media types
Contemporary design with finished steel rods
